message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the success of LSTMs in overcoming the vanishing gradient problem in RNNs. This topic is closely related to machine learning (cs.LG) and neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also presents a new class of RNNs that compute an element-wise weighted sum of context-independent functions of the input, which is relevant to natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and computer vision (cs.CV).
